items.title: Exercise 1: Fire Safety Drill Report
items.text:
Memo: Results of the Annual Fire Drill

The annual fire drill was conducted on Tuesday at 10:15 AM. The building was fully evacuated within 4 minutes and 30 seconds, which is within our target of 5 minutes. 

Observations:
1. All fire wardens were present and followed their protocols correctly.
2. One fire exit in the basement was partially blocked by cleaning supplies. This hazard must be addressed immediately. 
3. A few staff members attempted to take their laptops with them. In the future, ensure that all personal items are left behind to speed up the evacuation.

Remember: In a real emergency, the lifts shall not be used under any circumstances.

questions.question: Was the evacuation time successful?
options: Yes, it was under the 5-minute target
The text doesn't mention the target
questions.explanation: The text says 'within 4 minutes and 30 seconds, which is within our target of 5 minutes'.

questions.question: What hazard was identified during the drill?
questions.explanation: Observation 2 mentions a fire exit in the basement was partially blocked.

items.prompt: Exercise 2: FM Vocabulary. What does 'HSE' stand for in the UK?
items.explanation: HSE is the UK regulator for workplace health and safety.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: Formal Instructions. Rewrite this informal rule formally: 'Don't smoke in the office.'
items.modelAnswer: Smoking is strictly prohibited on the premises.

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Imperatives. Use a direct imperative to tell staff to wear their ID badges: '____ (wear) your ID badges at all times.'
items.modelAnswer: Wear your ID badges at all times.

items.prompt: Exercise 5: FM Chunks. To 'conduct a risk assessment' means:
options: To systematically evaluate potential dangers in an activity
To ignore the rules and hope for the best
items.explanation: A risk assessment is a formal process for identifying and mitigating hazards.
